div.span:
News at Our District:
(See each school page for additional news stories)

p.span: It’s time for Hickman County Alumni to help the 2020 graduates achieve their dreams of furthering their education!

span.span: Hickman County Schools may continue to provide reimbursable meals to low-income children during school closures related to the novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) for students receiving free and reduced lunches.

span.b: Despite their not having been in the building for over a month, the recognition of Hickman County Elementary’s top students continues as Principal Richard Todd recently placed signs in the yards of seven HCES Students of the Month for April.

td.a: HCHS Students Awarded GSP, CHA, GSA, and Gatton Honors

span.span: Five HCHS students have earned statewide recognition for being selected to participate in a variety of prestigious academic programs.

Hickman County School Superintendent, Casey Henderson, met with Hickman County Elementary School’s SBDM council on April 13, 2020 and began the process of hiring a new principal for the upcoming school year.

p.span: The council came up with a list of qualifications they would like to see the next principal meet.

br.span: Hickman County Elementary School recently recognized its Citizens of the Month for February. The FALCONS FLY character trait emphasized in February has been Show Respect to Myself and Others.

td.a: HCMS Advances to Regionals in 2020 Governor's Cup

span.p: Hickman Co Middle School Academic Team showed their Falcon Pride and their academic talents at the 2020 District Governor’s Cup this weekend. Hickman Co placed 2nd in the District overall.

br.span: MPK Group along with Hickman County food service director Megan Adams, principal Mr.Todd, & the student council participated in taste testing new items to add to the school menu! The kids' favorite items were chicken drumstick for lunch & chicken and waffle sandwich for breakfast!”

Hickman County Elementary School recently conducted its canned food drive. HCES students and staff collected 889 cans and food items, all of which were donated to The Mission House to benefit local families.

Students in Kindergarten through 6th grade showcased their skills with clay by creating various food items. Students were able to share their work with the community at an art show after the music program. Click Read More for pictures !
The Hickman County Schools choir recently hosted its winter performance, treating family, friends and other music lovers to a variety of Christmas songs.

a.title: HS Heisman winners pose for a photo.

img.title: HS Heisman winners pose for a photo.
img.alt: HS Heisman winners pose for a photo.

td.a: Lusk and Abernathy Named HS Heisman Winners

span.p: On Tuesday, November 12, 2019, the Heisman Trophy Trust announced the 2019 Heisman High School Scholarship School Winners. From an applicant pool of thousands of high school scholar-athletes graduating with the class of 2020, more than 3,600 have been named School Winners in the Heisman Trophy Trust’s scholarship competition. Hickman County High School is proud of our school winners Gracie Lusk and Tyler Abernathy.

Sophomores Rhett Dalton, Jacy Hicks, Emily Johnson, and Garrett Ward have been selected to attend this year’s Hugh O’Bryan Youth Leadership Seminar (HOBY). These students were selected based on leadership skills, community service, GPA, teacher recommendation, and an essay written about why they would like to attend the seminar. Each spring, 10,000 high school sophomores from across the country join one of HOBY’s 70 State Leadership Seminars to hone their leadership talents and apply them in becoming effective, ethical leaders in their homes, schools, workplaces, and communities.

span.div: HCES Library is selling a limited number of Falcon ornaments. Each is 3 1/4 inch acrylic with our HC Falcon. $7.00 each and comes in own gift box. Please see Mrs. Taylor at the elementary library to purchase.
